values:
I just came from business law and I know I sound like a huge dork, but it is my favorite part of my day. My roommates are going to country night, but I think I'm going to study tonight because I feel more studious now than I've felt in a while. On that note, I will share my horrible course schedule with you for next semester, which, oddly, I'm kind of looking forward to.

Summer:
FIN 301- Intermediate Business Finance
FIN 401- Principles of Investments and Security Markets

Fall '06:
FIN 351- Insurance
BLS 464- International Bus. Law
ACC 464- Tax Accounting
MGT 302- Operations Management (I dropped this class this sem. bc I am a retarded)
ECO 301- Money and Banking
ENG 338- Black Literature
ART 160- Begining Ceramics
BLS 235- Mock Trial Practicum

so yeah...six "real" classes @ 3 credit hours each =18 hours, plus 1 hour of ceramics and 1 hour of mock trial= 20 lovely credit hours, and 16 of those in the business school. I better make a lot of $$$ some day. And you wonder, "why do you have to take 20 hours of pure shit courses?" Because I dropped classes and took horseback riding, power walking, and wood working this semester. I rock.
Last night after Ben Folds I passed out and woke up at 3:30 PM!!!! I missed my power walking class, but I did wake up in time for accounting at 4. Who does that?!

JenjenCowman (10:18:44 PM): but we have to work on our grammar, it's "you're"
Jobake08 (10:19:42 PM): dont give a shit
Jobake08 (10:20:02 PM): correcting grammer is one of the most unattractive things a person can do
JenjenCowman (10:21:53 PM): i know, but it's so painful for me...like today during our finance exam, it would say something like "the companies IRR is 12%" and i would have to scratch it out and write "company's" because it's so painful for me to read
Jobake08 (10:22:09 PM): ok so keep it to yourself
JenjenCowman (10:22:45 PM): so, i'm sorry. i wont correct anymore. i'm going to take a nap now
Jobake08 (10:22:51 PM): ok

I would have liked to tell him that he spelled "grammar" incorrectly, but I think he would have been too mad.

I am at the library "studying." I am also sucking on sweet tarts, the chicks ducks and bunnies kind...which reminds me of a story...:

The other day i was driving home from Oxford and I saw this sign that said "Chucks and Dicks for sale," and I was really confused for a few minutes, and then I figured out that I am dyslexic and it said "chicks and ducks."

The end.

Dear Jason,

I am bored. Please start writing in your lj asap. I do not tell your secrets.

Fondly,

Jen

1. Starbucks
2. Henri Bendel candles in Vanilla Bean
3. Getting my hair cut/colored (because it's so expensive)
4. Expensive handbags/shoes
5. Naps

(and KC, I am NOT tagging anyone because this is pretty gay)

so i'm sitting in a study room (at a Miami branch campus(b/c i all the oxford mkt'ing classes were full), that's pretty key here) and this guy starts talking to me. He asked me what my sign was, then got on his laptop so see if we were a "match," and apparently we were. and then he read our "couples horoscope." so then he asked me if i wanted to leave with him because he was "antsy in his pantsy." I of course declined. Then he asked me if i would at least go and get high with him. another no. so he left, and i was relieved.
Then he came back, and gave me a green sucker. His explanation for this was that it is "a fact that green dye in candy makes you horny." Then I left. Totally disgusting/outrageous. 
This was probably one of the most awkward experiences I have ever been in.

P.S.: I also learned that he has a 4 yr old son.


So I will never take a class at a Miami branch campus again.
Since it's finals week, I'm wearing sweats and flannel pants and no make-up all week long, and no one can think anything of it.

Now that I am 21 and have the luxury of buying alcohol, it has gotten a little out of hand. If I'm not drinking wine, I buy these Woodchuck apple cider beers in amber. So last night I drank one, finished it, then started drinking another one, but it was like 3am and I was tired.  I took some pills and washed it down with my beer (bc i was too lazy to go get water). Then placed the 1/2 full beer on my nightstand and I woke up this morning and drank the other half for breakfast. nice, jen.
I left my contacts in for like 3 or 4 days like a dumbass. I took them out tonight and i have rings around my eyes from where my contacts were...It basically looks like I still have them in.

Tonight when I went to my night class, there was a stray cat outside the building. It looked skinny and hungry. I tried to call it and catch it, and take it home to add to my other 11 cats, but it wouldnt let me. I feel so sad that he's out in the cold tonight with no food and water. 
Then I feel bad about myself because I care more about animals than people. Like, when I watched American Psycho, I was way more upset that Patrick Bateman was going to kill that cat than when he killed any of the people. And I felt way worse when I saw animals swimming around rather than people.

"Give me some tits!"- That quote pretty much sums up my week.


PS: If you are my friend, please take my cell phone away from me when I am drunk. Thanks.

My classes for next semester:

MW(F):
MGT 302, Operations & Supply Chain Management-  8:00 am - 8:50 am MWF (3 cr)**.
ACC 225-The Accounting Process, 4:00 pm - 5:15 pm MW (1 cr) (this one is over feb 10). 

TR:
ENG 143, American Lit 1945-Present, 9:30 am - 10:45 am TR (3 cr).
FIN 301, Business Finance, 11:00 am - 12:15 pm TR (3 cr).
ECO 301, Money And Banking, Class 3:30 pm - 4:45 pm TR (3 cr).
EDL 204, Sociocultural Studies In Educ, 5:00 pm - 6:15 pm TR (3 cr).
Independent Study (one hour in ACC and one hour in B-law)(2 cr).
and some kind of PHS class? Maybe Individual Exercise. (2 cr).
=20 hours

**I'm going to try to force add into a different MGT 302 class so I will have MWF free after Feb 10 (Boston!!). I am also trying to get into ENG 256 (I would drop eng 143), which is Russian Literature in English Translation, and it also fufills one of my international business electives (my minor). I took the EDL class because it should be easy and I need credit hours...maybe I'll drop it and take something else?

So...my T/R's will suck, but it may be worth it? i dont know.. I also hate my major but refuse to change it.


Now I have to study for stats. I hate stats so much and I am so glad that it will be over in a matter of weeks.

I miss Boston. Not that I havent missed it constantly since I left. But I felt alive there. I loved waking up, going the the Starbucks across from CFA, and walking down Com ave. I felt like I was really living and in the middle of something magical and exciting. In Ohio it seems like I'm just here.
It's 18 degrees outside. I'm cuddling up and going to bed.

My weekend was pretty lame. I went home- my mom, sister and I watched The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants. Then I got into a fight with my dad because apparently I have too many bottles of salad dressing on the shelf and my dad couldnt find his candy bar...only in my house. So I left early and came back to my apt and finished up a management project, I'm currently working on a paper, and I have to learn 6 chapters of marketing before tomorrow at 7:00pm. 
I got flowers from a boy last week for teaching him econ...and I'm going out with him this week...and he's pretty cute. Score.
I ordered chinese for dinner...I usually go for the chicken pad thai, but I was brave and ordered something else. That was a bad decision. I'm still kind of upset about it, actually.
Like 8 more days until my glorious reunion with "the cousins." I am also excited for uncle Jim's homemade wine.
KC Downey is way too cute for words...i hope he starts getting dates on the 4th floor of Mugar soon.

Last night we got drunk and tazored ourselves. Actually it wasnt a tazor gun, it was a little hot shot with a 9 volt battery. Josh found it in some section 8 housing he was painting. And by drunk, I actually only had two beers- I have class at 9am, so I have to be responsible.

OMG I love this summer.

EDIT:

This is exactly what it was (it feels kinda good, really):

http://www.sheddselfdefense.com/talon.htm

I have to a math problem I am stuck with and I have to turn my hw in tomorrow at 9am...so any help would be MUCH appreciated.

A stone is dropped into a lake, creating a circular ripple that travels outward at a speed of 80 cm/sec. Find the rate at which the area within the circle is increasing after 4 seconds.

You can do this problem however you want. But I am stuck. Jason, you need to get your mathletes on this please. Thanks.

It's 4pm, I just woke up a hour ago and took a shower, etc. I'm totally hungover and keep finding bruises all over my body.
Yesterday I went to a 4th of July party with mom's side of the family. I always forget how much fun they are. I ate a ton of food, then took off with my three second cousins to their apartment.  I cannot believe these girls have been my cousins all my life and we have never hung out before. We partied with 4 other guys that live in their building, played corn hole, took shots, played flip-cup, drank beer and smoked outside on their lawn and watched a little of the fireworks. At like 2 am we all came inside toasted off our asses and watched Dazed and Confused. I fell into the bathtub while trying to use the bathroom- I have bruises everywhere and my entire right arm is really sore. Then, unfortunately, I hooked up with some guy that looks like Doug off of King of Queens. That's about it. Today I feel like shit and I have a ton of homework to do.

This is a phrase I hear often, probably because most of the people on my aim list are complete retards. These mistakes bother me most:

1) There, Their, They're
2) your, you're
3) two, to, too (most people seem to be catching on to this)
4) Then and Than (somehow people always use them incorrectly)
5) Spit and Spat, it's surprising how tons of people just don't know the past tense for spit (and also shit/shat)
6) the pronunciation of "picture"- i hatehatehate when people say "pitcher"
7) its and it's

I studied econ all day today, with VERY frequent breaks. I have a hard accounting test on Tuesday, but I haven't touched it. I also never did my homework for the most recent chapter of it. I hope I have a really good attention span and study day Monday. Ughhh I hate Finals!

Sometimes when I leave my computer and come back, it has turned itself off. Then, I will turn it back on and it will say that is has just recovered from a serious error. I run my virus scanner and it never detects any viruses, etc. What is going on?! This is really upsetting. This never used to happed until the last month or so.

I keep going downstairs thinking I will study but end up watching tv.
I cannot wait for school to be over so I can read. I will finish these books:
-Dreams from My Father
-All Souls
Then I plan on reading a ton more. I can't wait to finally read what I want.
I need to clean my room. Tonight I took down 8 cups that were sitting on my desk and put them in the dishwasher.
Finals are going to kill me if I dont start working soon.

I got a parking ticket from the city of Oxford right before SB..but before I left I forgot to pay the ticket. I just remembered I even had it a few days ago, and I dont even know if I still have the ticket. The thing is is that the fine grows larger over time. So what would happen if I just forgot to pay it? And, I was watching the news the other day and in Cincinnati they have days where you can pay your parking tickets without any late charges, for the original amt of the ticket. I wonder if they have this ever in oxford? probably not.

Tonight I met my friend Chelsea's guy friend Jon. But when I met him he had one of the legs of his sweatpants rolled up...so i asked him why he did that...and how i never understood why people did it...yay for good first impressions. Oh, and he said he had scratched his leg and his pants leg just came up. Then he came up with this analogy about how the rolled up pants leg for black people is like the equivalent to popped collars for gay ass white kids.

Anyhow, I was embarrassed I even opened my mouth; but i have always wondered that.

I never have anything good to update. I feel like my life is so boring here at Miami. And with 13 days left, my attention span is completely gone. What should I be doing now?..studying for an econ quiz that I have tomorrow, and instead, I am updating, which I hardly ever do.

Speaking of my non-existant attention span, today in accounting our prof was using an overhead to show us different examples of how warranties and discounts, etc are handled. Except, there was a tiny little bug crawling around on it, and instead of paying attention, I zone out and watch the bug move around.

Also, I went to go drop my golf class. I just kinda stopped going to class, and after 3 absences you dont get credit. It's a credit/no-credil class, but I did learn that the prof can still give me a WF, but it wouldnt affect my GPA. That would still suck though from a stupid credit/no credit golf class.

I sent my transient application to Kent State today for my summer class. Hopefully I can get it at a community college, but I wont know until their schedule comes out on May 2. But if I can't, I'll take calculus at Kent and stay with my super sweet 40 yr old cousin (mom's cousin). I need to get this situation resolved soon so I can figure out where to make some GDP over the summer.

Oh, and to my excitement, Coldplay is coming to Columbus in August. Vegas and Columbus, who would have guessed?

My roommate will be running in the marathon on Monday. I really wanted to come, but I can't because I have a huge accounting project I have to turn in in person on Monday. But... if you guys are going to go watch, and you want to make her a poster or something, i'm sure she'll love it (her boyfriend just told her he can't go now, so no one will be cheering for her and she's bummed).

"The ultimiate mix of emotion would be like my mother-in-law driving off a cliff in my new BMW." and..."Don't be that retard who tried to steal accounts payable." 

He makes accounting so much more enjoyable.

I feel like I havent read many books after this thing.  I have hardly read at all since I left BU.  Just Accounting/Econ/Marketing text books.  Despite how much I hated the tons and tons of constant reading I had to do at BU, I kind of miss it (the reading, I def miss boston, too).


Tomorrow I have an advising appointment. I need to declare my thematic sequence and concentration, but I think I'm going to wait. I still have some core business classes left to take before I had to decide. Lately I've been having little panic attacks about declaring a major. Do people actually enjoy business classes? I mean, I def think econ is interesting, but am I supposed to enjoy learning about depriciation and cash flow and bonds when I walk into acccounting? I freak out about having to choose something I want to do for the rest of my life, then I think I know, and then the next week I'm panicking again. If I were not going to major in something business, I would be a public relations major and marketing minor.  Their salaries are not so hot,  a lot of the time, though, esp starting out. People always say that money doesnt buy happiness, and that if you love your job that money is less important. I dont think that's true, at least entirely. I think after a certain amount of money, then it's true. But without money and a desired lifestyle you're sure to be unhappy. I actually learned about this in economics.
So, I guess if I keep on with my something business major, which is still what I'm planning on, I need to decide on a thematic sequence. It would be pretty ideal to take a thematic sequence and turn it into a minor complementing my major, but I still feel like I want to take my thematic sequence in COM, and take a few PR classes, even though it's not offered as a minor. Ohhh college...

This was Josh's (aka heartbaker) away message today: 

"***If you want to see Chinatown, there will be 2 showings in my room, check my door for times**."

I think he's trying to get frosh cgs girls in his room.

Good luck Em and Ash and Aaron with your finals!

Spring is in the air, finally.

Oxford translation: 90% of Miami girls can been seen in Burberry headbands and huge sunglasses.
if fate does exist, i keep fucking it up.

I went home friday with my friend Steph. Steph's mom picked us up and we drove to Middletown on our way home and went to Target, etc. So, we pass by this kinda big buidling with LOTS of nice cars in front, and everywhere. It said "Hustler" on the front. So I'm like, "it's pretty funny that someone would name their car dealership "Hustler." But to my surprise, Steph's mom informed me that it was not a car dealership. Who would have guessed there's an actual Hustler store in Middletown? And it must get a lot of business, because there were a lot of cars in the lot :)
I hate MS Excel. It is seriously making my life on Tuesdays and Thursdays horrible.

I had an accounting test today, I thought I did okay until the very end, then I fucked it up when I blanked on income statement and balance sheet stuff. At least I got the 5 points extra credit for going to that little ACC Job Seminar last Friday.
Then tomorrow I have an Econ quiz, CSA 141 test, which I'm for sure going too fuck up. Then Wednesday I have an Econ test. Lovely, huh?
After my test today my parents picked me up at the Business School and took me out to lunch/dinner. They had been in Cincy for the day, so that was really nice. I felt like i was in elementary school again.
Anna and I decided that we're going to Europe this summer with 2 other girls. I want to go to Italy (Rome, Venice) and France (Paris, and then the south of France, like Nice). We're doing this after our summer classes in August. I cant wait.
I also cannot wait until August because I just bought tickets to a Red Sox game for me and Nick, and I'm excited (understatement)to see him again. Hopefull by then I will have completed all my business core courses and admit into the Business School with a 3.0. 
I need to start studying for econ. and if anyone wants to explain what "relative, mixed, absolute" in Excel, I would appreciate it.

I'm dropping my political science course and picking up a basic ice-skating course. I'm such a bum. The worst though is that I have to take a drop form to my prof and have her sign it...I never know what to say. It's a little awkward, like "hey, um, I need to drop your class, will you sign this for me?" I made a friend in econ! I have to walk like 2727363 miles everyday...in ridiculous temperatures. I'm also being consumed by television. I only got about 4 channels last semester, and have never had cable, and for the first time in my life i do! I was watching Training Day at 2am this morning. And of course I watched American Idol tonight.
I think that's it for now.
Bye kids!

I have an exam at 7:30am (not kidding) tomorrow. I studied, but now I cant sleep. And I am so wearing pj's to class tomorrow. I was going to study more, but I just realized that I lost my study guide somewhere between Shriver (where i went to study) and my apt. fuck.

One more week and my semester is over. Yay!
I turned in my last papers of the sem. today.
I studied econ with Chelsea for 3 hours.
We ran into a problem that we couldnt figure out...
So she called our prof at 9pm on his cell. wtf?
I need a 98% on my econ final to get an A- in the class.
I love econ and want to major in it.
Someone told me that I talk like Elle Woods.
I want to become a vegetarian.
I want to go to grad school in Boston.
I have $3 in my checking acccount :/
I'm sooo tired of Ohio.
And everything.

This is what happpened today:
i wore a boston univerisity t-shirt today. so i'm walking to class and i look down the the uni was sticking out way more than the ity...my right boob is def bigger than my left one, i was really paranoid about it the rest of the day. then i was thinking about it, and my right foot is a little bit bigger, my right fingers are bigger, and my right wisdom teeth are fully in whil my left ones are not. is this normal, since i'm right handed?

My life is really boring right now. I decided that I am not going to party from now until december 15th because i need to start doing my work that i havent been doing for a while. I'm so stressed out about all my finals and all my work and studying that i have to get done and blah blah blah. Anyhow, I saw Closer friday- very good. And I spend ridiculous amounts of money at banana republic and kenneth cole. i need to get a job there or something. this is boring, i'm going to stop now.

My dad says my being a democrat is a form of rebellion, since he is republican.

I hate when girls wear dresses over jeans. Just wear one or the other, please.

The best part of my day was when this girl started yelling at another in the middle of campus because she was holding a faux Gucci purse.

I hate the guys that live above me. Extremely.

 I want pizza. I think I'm pre-menstraul.

 I sat down at 8pm to write a paper, and still haven't started it.

 I just painted my nails "resort perle."

I emailed Fawell yesterday just to say "hi."

I'm moving out of my apartment and into a nice condo with 2 other girls next semester.

My cousin (who goes to UC) has more facebook friends at Miami than me.

My paper is actually a rhetorical analysis of a speech for my com class. I'm analyzing Obama's speech from the DNC.

Now I want to read his book Dreams From My Father. Maybe I'll do that over Thanksgiving or X-mas break?

It was 67 degrees here today.

I'm going home this weekend. I want to see The Edge of Reason with my mom.

Yeah..so let me tell you about my day...

I was up until 5am writing my speech, partially because my internet decided to randomly not work for like 2 hours last night.  I gave it in front of my class at 2pm.  I woke up at 10am, practiced the speech,then went to the computer lab to make my visual aid for my speech because my printer is broken and I still havent bothered to buy one because I can print stuff for free in Bachelor. Word. Then, I somehow managed to lock my keys inside my apartment. I had to push my window open from the outside and jump through it, and I looked like an ass to everyone walking by.  Then I got kinda scared that someone could easily push open my window and kill me while I'm sleeping. Now, I am insanely tired and want to take a nap. I do, however have 2 papers, a test, and a quiz next week. I should go to Starbucks and bust out a paper because this weekend is Mountain Dew, and my cousin Katie is coming down from Canton. I'll probably end up napping.
So yeah....have a good weekend kids. <3 jen

I thought this was funny. This is where I go to school now:

How many college students does it take to screw in a light bulb?
~At Michigan it takes 2, 1 to change it and 1 to brag how they did it every bit as good as an ivy league school
~At OSU it takes 2, 1 to screw it in and 1 to  time it to make sure they did it faster than Michigan
~At OU it takes 5, 1 to bring the weed and 4 to smoke it while they all imagine they did it
~At BG it takes 0 b/c they are all too drunk from the night before to care whether or not the lights are on
~At Miami it takes 0 cuz everyone refuses to do it until they can find a J. Crew light bulb

Hi Kids! I just went grocery shopping. That's so awkward for me. Usually I try to just fit everything into one of those little baskets, but then I like to play this little game called "how long can Jen go w/o going to the grocery store?" so today I had to push around one of those mommy carts b/c I needed lots of stuff. I feel way too domestic and grown up doing that. I hate it.

 I had a pretty good weekend. last night I took my sister and her two friends to this little haunted thing in Middletown. I was more scared than 3 12 yr olds. Then we watched Blair Witch 2 and I had to wait until morning to drive home because I didnt want to enter my apt in the dark. Loser.

I've pretty much done nothing today. I Skipped my only class...I suck... I think I'll take a little nap and then I have to get ready to go to this little sorority meeting @ 9. Then I need to study econ like whoa. Anyhow, tomorrow is Nov. 2nd and ALL OF YOU NEED TO GO VOTE!!!!!

The Red Sox make me think of nights at the GSU, Bars with Anna at Fenway, and lively crowds at Kenmore Square.  Anna and I call each other every time the Red Sox score. So you can only imagine how excited we were when they finally won a game tonight. Yay! Okay, so they just have to win 3 more games...
These were my favorite times in Boston last year. I loved how the lights of Fenway lit up Boston, I loved the Citgo sign and the "Go Sox" lights on the Pru, I loved watching kids tip over cars and the police lined streets, Com Ave after a Red Sox victory, and I secretly loved how Anna would embarrass me with her "Yankees Suck" cheers or by harrassing the many New Yorkers sporting Yankee apparel. These are some of my best memories of my year at BU.
